question: Which of the following systems shall not be permitted to be located in an outdoor enclosure?
options: Manifolds for gas cyclinders with or without reserve

question: What system is used to monitor the operation and condition of the source supply of each medical gas and vacuum piping system?
What system is used to capture and carry away gases away from anesthesia or analgesia equipment?
What is not part of a typical category 1 medical gas vacuum system?
options: An inlet at lcoations where patient suction could be

question: What is a pnuematic terminus of a piped gas system? Other than critical continuous duty, nonflammable medical life support type gases.
What guide is for preparation of precautionary labeling and marking of compressed gas containers?
What device that automatically reduces gas under high pressure to a usable lower working pressure?
Under the risk categories, what category does major injury or death to patients or caregivers?
The riser is the ______ pipe that connects the main line to various levels of the facility?

The main text of which contains only mandatory provisions using the word shall to indicate the requirements of a ______ and suitable for adoption into law. Non-mandatory provisions shall be located in an appendix or annex are not to be considered requirement of a _______.
Oxygen enriched atmosphere is the concentration of oxygen that exceeds _____ percent by volume.
Medical support gas, nitrogen or instrument air is used to operate ______ ?
Manufacturers shall design their medical air compressors to exclude _______ from the air stream and compression chamber?
Facility systems in which failure of such equipment is likely to cause minor injury to patients or caregivers shall be designed to meet what category?
Building, structure or space used to house chambers and all auxiliary service equipment for medical applications and procedures at pressures above normal atmospheric pressures?
A DISS connector is a system of ______ medical gas and vacuum connectors comply with CGA V-5
A _____ device is used for connecting the outlets of one or more gas cyclinders to the central piping system?
A chemical element that, at normal atmosphere temperatures and pressures, exsist as a colorless, odorless and tasteless gas and comprises about 21% by volume of the earth’s atmosphere.
A factory assembled product designed for anesthetics or convenience that contains medical gas outlets or vacuum inlets, piping, or other related to medical gases is a ______ ?
A non-interchangeable connection, usually a DISS connector, which is the termination of the pipeline and which is intended to be detached only for service, a _____ shall be used
A portion of the health care facility designated by the governing body that serves a specific purpose is called  ____ ?
A system of non-interchangeable medical gas and vacuum connectors shall comply with ______ for low pressure connections for medical gas applications?
options: The joint commission comprehensive manual for hospitals
CGA V-5 Diameter index safety system
answer: CGA V-5 Diameter index safety system

question: A warning system within an area uses a ______ that provides continuous visible and audible surveillance of category 1 and category 2 medical gas and vacuum systems?
An active system or equipment whose failure is not likely to cause injury to patients, staff or visitors shall be designed to meet what category?
Within a single patient room or critical care area to provide access for two or more gases through a common delivery system. Which would be used?
options: Surface mounted medical gas rail system (MGR)
answer: Surface mounted medical gas rail system (MGR)

question: Atmosphere Absolute (ATA) is the pressure of the earth’s atmosphere, 760.0 mmHg, 101.325 kPa, or______ psia. Two ATA = two atmospheres.(See also 3.3.12, Atmosphere.)(HYP)
Any liquefied or vaporized gas alone or in any combination with other gases that is classified as a drug
A bulk nitrous oxide system has a storage capacity of more than _____ pounds of nitrous oxide
A chemical process of oxidation that occurs at a rate fast enough to produce heat and usually light in the form of either a glow or flame.What is this the definition of?
A low-pressure, vacuum-insulated vessel containing gases in liquid form.What is the definition for?
A valve, usually a needle valve, that precisely controls flow of gas.What is the definition for?

An assembly of equipment for supplying compressed gas (consisting of, but not limited to, storage containers, pressure regulators, pressure relief devices, vaporizers, manifolds, and interconnecting piping) that terminates where the gas, at service pressure, first enters the main line. The storage containers are either stationary or movable and include unconnected reserves on hand at the site, and the source gas is stored as a compressed gas or cryogenic fluid.What type of system is this?

Equipment, materials, or services included in a list published by an organization that is acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction and concerned with evaluation of products or services, that maintains periodic inspection of production of listed equipment or materials or periodic evaluation of services, and whose listing states that either the equipment, material, or service meets appropriate designated standards or has been tested and found suitable for a specified purpose.

Exists at cryogenic temperature, approximately −184.4°C (−300°F) at atmospheric pressure. It retains all of the properties of gaseous oxygen, but, in addition, when allowed to warm to room temperature at atmospheric pressure, it will evaporate and expand to fill a volume _____ times its liquid volume.
What is the permitted use of the medical-surgical vacuum system?
Which NFPA code should you refer to for Life Safety?
Which ASSE publication covers the design of medical gas systems?
Any location where moderate sedation, deep sedation, or general anesthesia is intended to be administered, is defined as?
A factory-assembled product designed for aesthetics or convenience that contains only the secondary valves of medical gas or vacuum outlets, piping, or other devices related to medical gases.

A variant on the cryogenic liquid container manifold shall be permitted to have three headers. Such a variant shall have a minimum of _____ connections required for each of the primary and secondary headers.
All pressure relief valves shall be made of brass, bronze or _________.
Cylinders in use and in storage shall be prevented from reaching temperatures in excess of  _________.
Final line pressure regulators, when used for bulk cryogenic liquid systems shall be of a ______ design.
In central supply systems using gas or liquid cylinders, each header shall have a _______ to prevent debris from entering the manifold controls.
Indoor locations for oxygen, nitrous oxide and mixtures of these gases shall not communicate with _______ locations.
Louvered openings for natural ventilation shall have a minimum free area of _____.
Manifolds for gas cylinders without reserve shall consist of ________ equal headers; each with an average day’s supply, but not fewer than ________ connections.

Manifolds in this category shall have a  _______ signal that visibly indicates the operating status of the equipment and shall activate an indicator at all ________ alarm panels to indicate when or just before changeover from one header to the other.
Medical air reconstituted from oxygen USP and nitrogen NF (synthetic air) produced using proportioning systems shall be required to meet the following.
options: Medical air shall be 19.5% to 23.5% oxygen
Shall be cleared for marketing and approved by the FDA
The mixture shall be analyzed continuously and recorded

question: Nitrous oxide and carbon dioxide using cylinders or portable containers shall be prevented from reaching temperatures lower than___________.
The gas produced by evaporation from the secondary header in a cryogenic liquid cylinder system shall enter the supply system ________ of the final line regulator.
The minimum clearance around the EOSC for a temporary source is ______ ft ?
The reserve header in a cryogenic liquid cylinder system shall have sufficient gas cylinder connections for an average day’s supply, but not fewer than ____connections.
When multiple buildings are served from a single cryogenic liquid oxygen source, where is it required to place the emergency oxygen supply connection?
Which of the following systems shall not be permitted to be located in an outdoor enclosure?
options: Manifolds for gas cylinders with or without reserve

question: Category 1 systems shall be permitted to serve spaces identified as ?
Which of the following are permitted to be located in the same storage facility as medical gas supply systems?
options: Cylinders containing the same medical gas as their perspective central supply
Station outlet repair parts or cylinders containing medical gases
answer: Cylinders containing the same medical gas as their perspective central supply

question: Which of the following is a requirement for the protection of oxygen cylinders from damage?
options: Cylinder valves not painted or altered
Required to be stored away from elevators
answer: Cylinder valves not painted or altered

question: In those portions of systems intended to handle oxygen at gauge pressures greater than _______psi, interconnecting hose shall contain no polymeric materials.
All medical gas and vacuum systems shall be provided with a point of access for connection of a temporary or supplemental source of supply. What is this called?
Aftercoolers, where required, shall be provided with individual _____________.
Carbon monoxide shall activate a local alarms when the CO level exceeds ______.
Compressors that are monitored for gaseous hydrocarbons shall be monitored on a __________ basis.
Dew point shall activate the required alarms when the dew point at system pressure exceeds _________.
Liquid ring compressor system shall have a reserve medical air standby header (1HR) or a____________.
Liquid ring compressors, service water and seal water shall be treated to control_________.
Medical air compressor systems shall have a pressure relief valve set at_______percent above line pressure.
Medical air compressor systems shall have a(n) _________ means to prevent backflow through all off-cycle compressors.
Medical air compressors shall be provided with a _____ restart function such that the compressors will be restarted after a power interruption.
Medical air compressors that are designed to separate the oil-containing section from the compression chamber shall be provided with a coalescing filter with a ________.
Medical air filters shall be located immediately upstream of the ________.
Medical air filters shall be sized for 100 percent of the system peak calculated demand and be rated for a minimum of ______ percent efficiency at _______ micron or greater.
Medical air receivers shall be provided with proper valves that allow the receiver to be ________ during service.
Medical air shall be sampled at a_____ NPS valved sample port downstream of the final line pressure regulator.
Medical air sources shall be used only for _______.
Medical air supply systems shall be required to _________.
options: Meet the requirements of medical air USP
Have less than 25 ppm gaseous hydrocarbons

question: Receivers for medical air shall be equipped with _____________.
The compressor air intakes shall be located outdoors at a minimum distance of ______ above the ground.
The medical air intake shall be located a minimum of ___ ft from all vehicular exhausts and noxious fumes.
The medical air intake shall be minimum 10 ft from all ____________.
Where medical air piping systems at different operating pressures are required, the piping shall separate after the _______.
Where liquid ring compressors with air-water separators are used, when the liquid level is above the design level, a sensor activates a(n) _______ alarm indicator.
Where liquid ring compressors or water-cooled aftercoolers are used, air receivers shall be equipped with a_____ sensor.

Where Liquid ring air compressors, and compressors having water-cooled heads, or water-cooled aftercoolers are used. They shall have a high water level alarm sensors located in the _____ and ______that will shut down the compressor systems and activate a local alarm.
options: Air-water separators and air receiver drain

question: When the backup or lag compressor is running, a(n) _______ alarm shall activate.
What type of connection should be used to connect the medical air compressors or vacuum pumps to their intake and outlet piping?
NFPA 99 code, states medical air may be supplied from except which of the following?
options: Reconstituted from oxygen USP and oil-free, dry nitrogen NF

question: Medical air dryers shall be provided with a __________ downstream of each dryer for maintenance
A WAGD source system shall activate the _________ alarm when the backup or lag producer is running.
A category 1 dedicated WAGD source shall consist    of ________ or more producers, each shall be sufficient to serve the peak calculated demand.
Additional WAGD producers shall be ______ activated when the producer(s) in operation is (are) incapable of maintaining the required vacuum
Category 1 medical-surgical vacuum sources shall consist of an automatic means to prevent  ______ through any off-cycle vacuum pump.
Category 1 medical-surgical vacuum sources shall, at a minimum, consist of _______ or more vacuum pumps.
Category 1 medical-surgical vacuum systems shall activate which alarm when the backup or lag pump is running?
If WAGD is produced by the medical surgical vacuum source, the total concentration of oxidizers of oxygen (%O2) shall be maintained below ______ percent.
If the WAGD system is joined with the medical surgical vacuum piping, it shall be connected at a minimum distance of ______ feet from any vacuum inlet.
Medical surgical vacuum receivers shall be made of what kind of materials ______ ?
Multiple vacuum pumps shall be permitted to be joined together to one common exhaust provided the common exhaust is sized to ______.
The WAGD Source shall be permitted to be located near the _______.
The medical-surgical vacuum exhaust shall be turned down and screened.  The screening shall be fabricated using what type of material?
The medical-surgical vacuum receiver shall be made serviceable without shutting down the system by _______.
options: An isolation valve where tee’d into main line
Being valved at the end of the main line
Any method to ensure continuation of service
answer: Any method to ensure continuation of service

question: The vacuum exhaust shall be at least ____ feet from any doors, windows, air intake and shall not discharge in a place of public assembly.

To determine the type of WAGD sources and systems shall be chosen by consultation with _______ having knowledge of the requirements to determine the type of system, number and placement of terminals and other required safety and operating devices.
Vacuum exhausts from multiple pumps joined together to one common exhaust shall be permitted provided each pump can be isolated by __________.
Vacuum producers (e.g., fans or blowers) designed for operations at vacuum below 130 mm (5in.) HgV shall be as follows
Vacuum receivers shall be capable of withstanding a gauge vacuum of _______ inches of mercury.
WAGD vacuum producers designed for operation at vacuums below _____ inches Hg/V shall be used only for WAGD service and not employed for other services.
What source shall not be used to power the venturi of a WAGD system?
When the medical-surgical vacuum pump(s) in operation is (are) incapable of adequately maintaining the required vacuum, additional pumps shall be _______ activated.
Filters shall be efficient to _______ and 99.7 percent HEPA or better, per DOE-STD-3020
For each oxygen concentrator a local alarm to indicate low oxygen concentration when a concentration lower than _____ percent is observed
The monitor shall be capable of monitoring _____ percent oxygen concentration with 1 percent accuracy
Oxygen concentrator supply units for use with medical gas pipelines shall produce oxygen meeting the requirements of?
On an oxygen for each concentrator unit used in the oxygen central supply system, an alarm indicating that oxygen concentration is below 91% shall activate what alarm?
Vacuum filtration shall be sized for _____ percent of the peak calculated demand while one filter or filter bundle is isolated.
Vacuum filtration shall be located on the ____ side of the vacuum producer
Vacuum filtration shall be at least _____ to allow one filter to be exchanged without impairing the vacuum system.

Use of oxygen concentrator supply systems as all three sources shall only be permitted after documented risk analysis by the ______ of the health care facility indidcating understanding of the inherent risks and defining how those risks shall be mitigated
A shutoff valve shall be placed at the immediate connection of each ________ system to the distribution piping system. What is the name given to the valve?
A shutoff valve shall be provided in the _______ supply line when the source valve is not accessible from within the building being served. What is the name given to this valve?
All valves except valves zone valve box assemblies shall be secured by any of the following means ________________.
options: Locked or latched in their operating positions
Located above ceiling, but remaining accessible and not obstructed

question: Immediately outside each vital life-support, critical care and anesthetizing location of moderate sedation, deep sedation, or general anesthesia there shall be located a (n) _____________ in each medical gas, or vacuum line or both.
In-line check valves shall not have threaded connections but shall have____________________.
New or replacement shutoff valves for medical gas pressure piping systems shall be permitted to be any type as long as they meet the following: ___________________ .
options: They have a minimum CV factor

question: Service valve shall be placed in the branch piping prior to any ______________ on that branch.
Shutoff valves for positive pressure gases shall ______________.
options: Provided with copper tube extensions for brazing
be cleaned for oxygen service by the manufacturer

question: The main line valve shall be located on which side of the source valve, when the main line valve enters the building.
options: Facility side of the source valve
Main line valve upstream of the service valve
answer: Facility side of the source valve

question: There shall be a zone valve immediately outside of anesthetizing location of__________________?
options: All or any of the above
answer: All or any of the above

question: What is the name given to the shutoff valve installed on all lateral branch piping from a main or riser?
What valve is permitted to be installed to isolate or shut off piping for servicing of individual rooms or areas?
What valves shall be readily operable from a standing position in the corridor on the same floor they serve?
With the approval of the authority having jurisdiction, in what areas shall the shutoff valves be permitted to be secured to prevent inappropriate access?
Bulk cryogenic liquid system require 3 ft clearance around three sides of the following:________.
The minimum clearance around the EOSC for a temporary source is ______ ft ?
The ______ valve shall be the line separating the applicability betweenNFPA 55Links to an external site.and this code.
Seals necessary for the operation of the valve and prevention of leaks  are __________?
In patient care spaces that are not anesthetizing locations, they shall be installed immediately outside the _________ being controlled.
The auxiliary source connection shall be ________ and secured.
